message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper proposes a novel approach for short text classification that incorporates a topic memory mechanism. The paper focuses on natural language processing and machine learning, which suggests that it is likely to belong to the cs.CL (Computation and Language) sub-category. Additionally, the paper deals with classification tasks, which could also place it in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. The use of memory networks and topic inference suggests that it could also belong to the cs.LG (Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-categories. Finally, the paper's focus on improving classification performance suggests that it could also belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
